  • The run module

    • How To Use This Module

The run module

Run PICNIC by providing an input deck or a group of input decks.

How To Use This Module

  1. Call the main function with a provided input deck or list of input decks.

  2. By default the workflow/pipeline will be built and run, but the advanced user can set the flag initialize_only to True and the workflow will be built, but will wait to be executed.

class picnic.run.Pipeline(fn)[source]

an object to hold the important attributes of a completed pipeline. In this case a pipeline is equivalent to a series of workflows appended on to each other.

build_workflow()[source]

build the entire pipeline’s workflow

class picnic.run.ProcessInputs(pargs)[source]

an object to process all inputs set up by the argument parser

fill_dox()[source]

use the csv build a dox and create new inps

initialize_pipelines()[source]

initialize all of the pipelines

picnic.run.create_parser()[source]

use argparse to correctly parse the arguments supplied by the user

Return:

-. an ArgumentParser obj

picnic.run.get_card_list(folder_path='/mnt/projects/PICNIC/src/picnic/cards/default_parameters', extension='.json')[source]

return a list of cards found in the cards.default_parameters sub-directory. We use this to determine which instances steps will be loaded.

Parameters:

-. folder_path : a file-like string, the path to find the json files -. extension : a string, the file type to search for the cards

Return:

-. a dictionary, cards and their associated picnic classes

picnic.run.infer_class_name_from_card_name(card_name)[source]

returns a string of the suspected class name by giving a card name. This assumes all spaces will be removed, the first word will be capitalized and CamelCase will be used for subsequent words.

Parameters:

-. card_name : a string, the name of the card

Return:

-. a string

picnic.run.initialize_instance_from_keyword(card)[source]

use the key to initialize the keyword class associated to the provided card

picnic.run.insert_parameters(inps, dox_file)[source]

creates new input decks from a list of template inps and a test readable dox file. This function will iterate over the template inps and add new parameters for each new run in the dox.

Parameters:

-. inps : a list, the inp templates -. dox_file : a file-like str, the text readable table

Return:

-. a list, of newly created input decks

picnic.run.main(fn)[source]
